Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was at the facility from the summer of 2022 until March of
2023. During that time, a staff member raped the youth in the
bathroom.
Investigation Interview:
Complainant was interviewed face-to-face on February 29,
2024. Complainant said Youth A reported to her this incident took
place sometime after Christmas 2022. Complainant said Youth A
reported the staff was a “new staff”, in their 20’s or 30’s, with dark
hair, was short and “bigger”, and was a “male acting like a
female”.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the Children’s
Assessment Center in Delta County on March 15, 2024. Youth
A said she was previously placed at Vassar House and between
December 31, 2022 and March of 2023 when no snow was on the
ground, but it was still cold outside, Staff 1 raped her. Youth A said
she and other youth from her unit were watching a movie in the
main building in the “movie room” and she needed to use the
bathroom, so Staff 1 brought her to the bathroom and stood in
hallway holding the bathroom door open. Youth A said there were
four stalls in the bathroom, and she was in the “last big stall”.
Youth A said once she was finished using the bathroom Staff 1
had come into the bathroom and shut the door. Youth A described
the bathroom stall door as latching from both the inside and the
outside and said Staff 1 unlatched the stall door and came into the
bathroom stall with her. Youth A said she began to scream for the
other staff that were working that day, unable to recall the names
of the staff stating two were male and two were female, however
no one responded to her scream. Youth A said Staff 1 took off her
pants, sock, shoes, then shirt, cornered her in the stall, put their
hands on her stomach area and pulled her to the ground placing
2

their body weight on top of her. Youth A said Staff 1 then took off
their shirt, shoes, socks, and pants and put their “dick inside” of
her. Youth A said Staff 1 was moaning and “moving up and down
to keep their dick inside”. Youth A said she was screaming for
help, felt very tense with her hands shaking, and felt she was
“going out of breath”. Youth A said it was very painful in her vagina
and stomach. Youth A said Staff 1 was moving their hands on her
breasts, head, and chest, moaning but never saying anything.
Youth A said Staff 1 raped her for about seven or eight minutes,
stating she was unsure why it ended. Youth A said Staff 1 then got
dressed and left the bathroom. Youth A said she laid on the floor
for about two minutes crying before getting up and dressed. Youth
A said once dressed she left the bathroom and stood in the
hallway for “a bit” before going back into the movie room to finish
watching the movie. Youth A denied any staff or youth being in the
bathroom or coming into the bathroom during the incident. Youth A
denied telling any staff or peer about the rape stating she was
scared and did not think anyone would care. Youth A described
Staff 1 as “bigger” with their stomach hanging over the pants at
the waistline, flat chested, dark brown/almost black pubic hair
around a dark brown penis. Youth A denied seeing any scars,
tattoos, or other identifying marks. Youth A said Staff 1 was a
“newer staff”, that was “quiet and stuck to themselves”. Youth A
said previously during a “circle time” all the youth and staff were
sharing a “fun fact” about themselves and Staff 1 shared that they
were transgender, born a female but identifying as a male. Youth A
said Staff 1 never talked to her prior to the incident, never said
anything during the incident, and did not talk to her after the
incident. Youth A said this was the one and only time anything like
this ever happened to her at Vassar House. Youth A said she
never had any issues or concerns with Staff 1 prior to or after the
incident.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on March 27, 2024. The
bathroom noted by Youth A was viewed. The bathroom stalls
lock/unlock on both the inside and outside of the stall. During the
tour, MDHHS worker was in the bathroom stall noted by Youth A
yelling and I stood in the “movie” room and could clearly hear her
yelling.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the Vassar
Police Department on April 6, 2024, by MDHHS worker
and Law Enforcement at Vassar Police Department.
MDHHS worker provide the following summary: “Staff
3

1’s identity was verified with his State Michigan driver's
license and the sex on the license was noted as "F" for
female. Staff 1 confirmed being employed at Wolverine
Human Services from November or December of 2022 until
January of 2023. He was full time before quitting. Staff 1
was honest about being born a female and later identifying
as a male. Staff 1 was wearing baggy blue jeans and a
hooded sweatshirt and it was clear Staff 1 has female
breasts, as they could be seen through the sweatshirt he
was wearing. The allegations were addressed with Staff 1
and his immediate response was "oh, I don't have one of
those" referencing a penis. Staff 1 said he sees an OBGYN
…. and is currently being treated for fertility and then will be
taking testosterone. Staff 1 said he does not know who
Youth A is. Staff 1 said the only time he was ever alone
with any of the youth, was at night when there was an issue
amongst youth in the unit. Staff 1 said the other staff, he
couldn't remember who it was, left to go get help and he as
alone for a minute or two with the whole unit. Staff 1 denied
ever being alone with the youth any other times, as he was
a new staff. Staff 1 denied ever taking youth to the
bathroom alone stating the bathroom in the unit was open
and if he was keeping line of sight, he'd be standing on the
other side of the bathroom area. Staff 1 was asked about
the youth watching a movie in the main building and he
remembers this happening at least one time stating it was
in a common room. Staff 1 couldn't detail what the room
looked like and denied ever taking anyone outside of the
movie room for any reason. Staff 1 denied the youth knew
he was transgender, stating he told the staff at his interview
but never made an "announcement" to the group. Staff 1
said one time, he mentioned having a "partner" and a youth
made a comment about his sexuality but that was it. Staff 1
denied ever touching or sexually assaulting Youth A.
• A review of all MISACWIS Incident Reports for Youth A
during the time Staff 1 was employed were reviewed. There
were fourteen incident reports for Youth A between
12/19/2022 and 1/09/2023. There were no incident reports
that involved Youth A and Staff 1.
• A review of MISACWIS incident reports for Staff 1 was
completed. Staff 1 is not listed as a Vassar staff member
and there are no incident reports in MISACWIS with Staff 1
listed.
• A review of two additional Vassar House internal incident
reports dated 1/3/2023 and 1/4/2023 were reviewed for
Youth A. Neither incident report included Staff 1.
4

• Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed and there were two
disciplinary actions completed. An Employee Counseling
form was completed on 1/7/23 stating “On 1/7/23 at 9:15pm
in unit 2, [Staff 1] was in a daze, not saying anything when
their name was called several times. Once got [Staff 1]
attention they looked lost and ran to the front unit door and
said where am I and proceeded walking out the door. [Staff
1 was asked several time if they were ok. [Staff 1]
continued to walk away then came back and stated his
name was Stanely and they have an identity disorder. [Staff
1] asked who I/staff was and then stated they were going
home. [Staff 1] was told to bring in some documentation
about their disorder. [Staff 1] said they also have multiple
personalities.” A second Employee Counseling form was
completed on 1/9/23 stating Staff 1 left in the middle of the
shift stating “I’m going home. I quit.” Staff 1 did not work
any additional shifts after 1/9/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Staff Qualifications as the
evidence from the investigation does not prove the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
